page.title: 08Whitfield Church
page.content: Saint Peter's lies about half a mile east of the main settlement of Whitfield. The plan is the rare 3 compartment: nave, chancel and apse to which a north aisle, porch and vestry have been added. The church had alterations and renovations in the C13 and 1894. Being restored again in 1972, when the furniture was renewed and the altar moved from the east to the north, to allow greater viewing. The bell was restored within the last 20 years, reputedly the oldest in Kent. The unique wooden cross was carved by a local man of River, as was the lecturn. The church acquired a single manual organ in 1979, originally built in Scotland. The vicar is Reverend John Philpott. Two services are held on Sunday, 9.15 a.m. and 6.60 p.m.
